entry.title: The Difference Between Alchemy API and thirdweb SDK?
entry.summary: As a software or web developer, you will work with different components, some of which you will use more often, like application programming interfaces (APIs) and software development kits (SDKs) mainly because developers are keen to improve the software development cycles. In modern-day software development, APIs and SDKs have become essential parts; because they have so much in common, they often get mixed up. In my opinion, in the first half of 2022, we had an uptrend in Developer Experience (DX), while User Experience (UX) dominated the second half. APIs and SDKs play an essential part in improving both experiences. A well-known SDK is Google SDK for analytics which developers use to get data about user behaviours. We also have Facebook SDK for advertising, which makes it easier for de…

entry.title: DevNTell - Cypherock
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Naman Seth gives us an overview of Cypherock: the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup 🌟 Developer Spotlight Naman joined Web3 back in 2017, degened his way through the space for 4 years while being a freelance marketer. Naman is currently leading BD at Cypherock. 🚀 About Cypherock Cypherock is a Consensys-backed startup, building the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup. The current issues with key management pose massive barriers to the adoption of decentralized technologies. Cypherock believes digital assets will have exponentially more value in the future and that will just not be limited to Cryptocurrency. Cypherock's mission is to empower people to be self-sovereign and to have the same peace of mind and control with their crypto and personal data that they have with their savings in the bank vaults. [Source] Website: https://cypherock.com Twitter: https://twitter.com/CypherockWallet GitHub: https://github.com/cypherock Naman's NFTd: https://nf.td/nmnsth Naman's Twitter: https://twitter.com/nmnsth 🎥 Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uq_Kx3-UTdE

entry.title: Create NFT Smart Contract with thirdweb and Chainlink
entry.summary: In this tutorial, we will build a custom ERC-721 NFT collection using thirdweb and Chainlink. We will use thirdweb ContractKit for the ERC-721 token standard, thirdweb deploy to deploy our smart contract to Mumbai Testnet, and Chainlink Data Feeds to fetch the realtime price of Matic to set the base price for minting NFT. We will build and deploy a smart contract that allows users to mint NFT. The user has to pay at least $1 in Matic to mint the NFT. We get the actual price conversion using Chainlink Data Feeds. What is ERC-721? ERC-721 is a free, open standard that describes how to build non-fungible or unique tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. While most tokens are fungible (every token is the same as every other token), ERC-721 tokens are all unique. The ERC-721 introduces a standard fo…

entry.title: DevNTell - Storedat.io
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, Developer DAO member Narb gives us an overview of his new venture called Storedat: Web3 storage made easy 🌟 Developer Spotlight If you'd like to learn a bit about Narb you can check out the following resources: Introductory blog post: https://narb.hashnode.dev/narb-a-web3-story Humans of D_D Podcast:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tm5lgiYHH2E
🧠 About Storedat Storedat is a GraphQL API built on top of existing web3 storage providers like Arweave and Filecoin. We exist to accelerate the adoption of decentralized storage by providing a provider agnostic way to read and write data with those protocols all the while abstracting away web3 from the user. No dealing with wallets, signing transactions, storing private keys, paying transaction costs, and so on. Just plug in and Storedat Resources: Website: https://storedat.io Sign up for the Beta: https://auth.storedat.io Docs: https://docs.storedat.io API Playground: https://perma.storedat.io/api/v1/graphql Starter template: https://github.com/Glosseta/storedat-api-starter-template Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/storedat_io Glosseta Foundation: https://www.glosseta.foundation 🎥 Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULpuwe108FY

entry.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this weeks episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak presents an overview of Blocktorch: observability for the decentralized stack 🌟 Developer Spotlight Gery has 6 years experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D 🙂 ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer. 🔥 About Blocktorch Blocktorch's mission is to build an end-to-end web3 observability platform to support engineers building dApps, similar to what DataDog achieved for the cloud but with a focus on decentralized backend architecture Website: https://www.blocktorch.xyz/
Careers: https://blocktorch.notion.site/blocktorch-careers-d9ddd67145354aa7a6c90f38aa13e08a
Docs: https://docs.blocktorch.xyz/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/blocktorch
Gery's Twitter: https://twitter.com/GeryPollak
Discord: https://discord.com/invite/5PdvH58gbj
🎥 Presentation

entry.title: Hedera x DevDAO: Build Faster DApps with Predictable Fees
entry.summary:
Following our exciting announcement of sponsoring Developer DAO, I'd like to introduce Hedera and the developer relations team further 👋. Hedera is an open-source public distributed ledger that uses the Hashgraph as its underlying consensus algorithm. Hedera offers excellent performance, scalability, and sustainability with native token and data (consensus) services and EVM-compatible smart contracts. Further your Hedera knowledge by visiting the Hedera documentation, where you'll have the opportunity to dive deeply into core concepts about the network. The Developer Relations, Documentation, and Community team supporting the Hedera network consist of the following:
Get Started Building on Hedera 🛠 Visit our getting started guide to set up your environment and be ready to start building…
